perturbation.original_text:
Article 1.Amendment and Termination of JV Agreement

a.As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 1.Amendment and Termination of JV Agreement

a.As of the VNBJ Closing, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate .
perturbation.explanation: By removing "except as expressly set forth in this Amendment" and "all references to \"Company\" or \"Companies\" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.", this creates a contradiction because later articles, such as Article 2, still reference back to the original JV Agreement and its clauses regarding D&O Indemnity which now have no clear definition or surviving application, creating uncertainty as to the scope of the termination.

perturbation.original_text:
Article 2.D&O Indemnity

Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 2.D&O Indemnity

The Nissin Parties agree to provide indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.explanation: Removing "Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement" removes the specific obligations to comply with the previously outlined sections of the original joint venture agreement, which specified scope and specific terms of Indemnity. Now without that reference it is ambiguous as to what Indemnification is agreed to. This contradicts what was agreed to in Article 1.

perturbation.original_text:
Article 1.Amendment and Termination of JV Agreement

c.Except as expressly set forth in this Amendment and notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in the JV Agreement (including Section 9.3.11 (Termination and Survival)), (a) effective as of the later of the VNBJ Closing and the VNBZ Closing, the JV Agreement shall terminate in its entirety with respect to the Veoneer Parties and (b) after the later of the VNBJ Closing and the VNBZ Closing, the Veoneer Parties shall cease to be a party to the JV Agreement and shall have no further obligations with respect thereto. For clarity, upon the later of the VNBJ Closing and the VNBZ Closing, the JV Agreement will remain in full force and effect in accordance with the terms thereof solely between the Nissin Parties and Autoliv AB with respect to the liquidation proceedings of ANRA.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 1.Amendment and Termination of JV Agreement

c.Effective as of the later of the VNBJ Closing and the VNBZ Closing, the JV Agreement shall terminate in its entirety with respect to the Veoneer Parties and after the later of the VNBJ Closing and the VNBZ Closing, the Veoneer Parties shall cease to be a party to the JV Agreement and shall have no further obligations with respect thereto.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "Except as expressly set forth in this Amendment and notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in the JV Agreement (including Section 9.3.11 (Termination and Survival))" and "For clarity, upon the later of the VNBJ Closing and the VNBZ Closing, the JV Agreement will remain in full force and effect in accordance with the terms thereof solely between the Nissin Parties and Autoliv AB with respect to the liquidation proceedings of ANRA." creates a scenario where the Survival clause mentioned is no longer clear. This is in contradiction to Article 1.d where the text says "termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable." Which means that Article 1.d now conflicts with 1.c.
